2.3. Images and Links¶

  1. We can add Images and Links in our web page to improve the look and feel of the WebPage.

2.3.1. Images¶

  1. The <img> tag is empty, it contains attributes only, and does not have a closing tag.
  2. The src attribute specifies the URL of the image.
  3. The syntax is :

<img src="url" alt="text">

  1. alt attribute specifies the alternate text which will be displayed if the image is not displayed due to some error.

2.3.1.1. Width and Height¶

  1. It specifies the width and height of the image. It is specified with the number of pixels.

2.3.1.2. Title¶

  1. This attribute helps to display a text when the mouse pointer is hovered over the image.

2.3.2. Links¶

  1. HTML links are hyperlinks. A hyperlink is a text or an image you can click to jump to another location outside of curremt page.
  2. The syntax is

<a href="url"> Link Text/Image </a>

  1. You can change the colors of links based on their current status, i.e. Unvisited, Visited, Hover, Active.

a:link|visited|hover|active

2.3.2.1. Target Attribute¶

  1. It specifies where to open the linked document.
  2. Syntax is :

<a href"url" target="_blank"> text </a>

target="_blank|_self|_parent|_top

2.3.3. Internal Links - Bookmarks¶

  1. In HTML we can create bookmarks, which are also know as internal links, which are used to traverse to different location within the same page.
  2. For this, first we need to create an ID at the target element, and call that target using a # from the link.
  3. Below example handles all the above scenarios.

<!DOCTYPE html>

<html>
<head>
<title>Example For CSS </title>
<style>
        h1 {
                text-align:center;
        }

        a:link {
              color:green; 
        }
        a:visited {
                color:blue;
        }
        a:hover {
                color:orange;
                text-decoration:none;
        }
        a:active {
                color:magenta;
        }
</style>
</head>

<body style="background-color:cyan">
        <h1 id="top">Hello World</h1>
        <h1 style="color:blue">How</h1>
        <h1>Are</h1>
        <h1>You</h1>

        This line1 is without `p` tag.<br>
        This line2 is without `p` tag.
        <hr>
        <p> This line1 is within the tag.</p> <br> <p>This is also within the tag.</p>


        <hr style=width:560px;height:30px;color:red;background-color:red>
        <hr size="30">

        <!--To add the image -->
        <img src="../images/1.png" alt="1.png" title="sun">
        <img src="../images/1.png" alt="1.png" title="sun" style="width:100px;height=100px;">

        <br>
        <!-- To add the internal link -->
        <a href="#top"> Top </a>

        <br>
        <!-- To add external link -->
        <a href="https://www.google.co.in"> Google.com </a>
<footer>
        <p>&copy www.Crestrou.com</p>
</footer>
</body>
</html>
